title: Match Bases and Solve for x
text: Since $$3*\log_{3}\left(x\right)=\log_{3}\left(x^3\right)=\log_{3}\left(27\right)$$ have the same bases both sides, we can take out the logarithm and get $$x^3=27$$. Solve for $$x^3=27$$ which gives $$x=3$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, b can not be negative. 3 is non negative. Therefore $$x=3$$ is the only solution for this equation.
